report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.08.0]
**INSTITUTION PALLIATIVE CARE CONSULT NOTE - - - - - DATE: **DATE[Nov 05 2009] REFERRING PHYSICIAN: **NAME[XXX, WWW M] (33965) - - - - - Reason for Consult: I am being asked by the following referring physician to see this patient in consultation: **NAME[XXX, WWW M] (33965) - - - - - HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: **AGE[in 60s] y/o woman known to our service from previous admit in 9/08 admitted 4/4 after cardiac arrest at home and then in ED. Had been on cooling protocol, now warmed, off sedation for last 90 minutes, neuro status remains very poor. Unresponsive, myoclonic head movement, eyes deviating upward, no gag, no cough, sluggish pupils. Neuro eval ongoing. No family present currently. Daughter **NAME[VVV] should be in later. In **DATE[Apr 09], pt listed her children as her decision-maker as she and her husband were estranged. Pt had DNR discussion at that time which concluded DNR if in a vegetative or nonrecoverable state. - - - - - Past Medical History: Condition 1: CAD s/p MI and stent; Condition 2: CRI; Condition 3: COPD; Condition 4: Renal artery stenosis; Condition 5: HTN; Other past medical history: Hypothyroid, s/p CEA - - - - - ALLERGIES: penicillin, sulfa drugs - - - - - MEDICATIONS: Oral morphine equivalent: Fentanyl and Versed just stopped; Rounding Report Medications: ACTIVE INPATIENT MEDICATION ORDERS aspirin 325mg Duotube Daily chlorhexidine topical 0.12% (Peridex... 15mL SwishSpit BID clopidogrel (Plavix) 75mg Duotube Daily heparin 5,000Unit(s) subQ Q8H insulin regular (HumuLIN R, NovoLIN... 0-12 Units subQ Q6H lansoprazole (Prevacid) 30mg NG Tube Daily levothyroxine (Synthroid) 100mcg Duotube Daily sodium bicarbonate (Neut) 20mEq NG Tube Daily ACTIVE INPATIENT PRN MED ORDERS ACUDOSE MULTI - INGREDIENT ITEM 1ea IV As DirCPOE ONE TIME MED ORDERS 4/04 05:06insulin regular (HumuLIN R, No... 6Unit(s) subQ ONCE 4/05 08:00potassium chloride (potassium chlor... 20mEq IV ONCE 4/04 04:42Sodium Chloride 0.9% (sodium chlo... 1,000mL IV ONCE 4/04 02:35Sodium Chloride 0.9% (sodium chlo... 1,000mL IV ONCE - - - - - Social History: Unable to obtain: Reason: pt unresponsive. some history available from chart; Home Situation: Had previously lived with a daughter; Family Structure and Relationship: Was estranged from husband. Has at least one daughter and one son; POA / Decision Maker: Per previous notes, daughhter; Awareness of Illness / Desired role: Pt unresponsive - - - - - Family History: Family history non-contributory - - - - - REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Unable to obtain due to: pt unresponsive - - - - - Rounding Report Vitals: VITALS: **DATE[Nov 05] 10:00 T: 36.3 BP:137/46 P:108 RR: 20 SaO2:100 FiO2: Ht: Wt: **DATE[Nov 05] 08:00 T: 36.1 BP:130/57 P:116 RR: 22 SaO2:100 FiO2: 60 Ht: Wt: **DATE[Nov 05] 07:00 T: 36.1 BP:117/55 P:114 RR: 23 SaO2:100 FiO2: Ht: Wt: **DATE[Nov 05] 06:00 T: 35.4 BP:100/57 P:113 RR: 29 SaO2:100 FiO2: Ht: Wt: 24 Hr Max Temp:36.3 36 Hr Max Temp:36.3 VITALS TIME:**DATE[Nov 05 2009] 11:11 General Appearance: No acute distress Skin: Other: Warm except R leg HEENT: No JVD; Other: ETT in place; minimal if any pupillary response. Upward gaze. Myoclonic jerks of mouth Lymph: Other: No LAD Pulmonary: CTA; Other: Vent sounds Cardiac: No murmur; No rubs Cadiac: No gallops Abdomen: Soft; Nontender; BS Present Extremeties: No edema; Other: R leg cool, dusky in lower calf, foot Neuro: Other: Not responsive Musculoskeletal: Not examined Genitalia: Not examined Rectal/Pelvic: Not examined Breasts: Not examined - - - - - Labs: Reviewed; Cr 2 and improving. troponin 0.16 Imaging: My interpretation; Head CT reviewed, agree with findings listed. - - - - - ASSESSMENT AND PLAN Assessment: **AGE[in 60s] y/o woman with chronic heart and kidney disease presents s/p cardiac arrest with poor neuro status and likely poor neuro prognosis. Awaiting further discussions with family - - - - - Problem/Diagnosis 1: Symptoms; Assessment/Plans: No bothersome symptoms. May need benzos for myoclonus once goals determined Problem/Diagnosis 2: Goals; Assessment/Plans: Will follow with you and address with family as appropriate. Based on previous code status discussions and current status, moving toward DNR/comfort likely most appropriate but will await further family discussions. Problem/Diagnosis 3: Disposition; Assessment/Plans: Will obviously depend on goals. Our SW staff will be available as needed. - - - - - Please notify me if you would like me to follow the patient. My advice regarding the following patient is listed above: **NAME[AAA, BBB CCC] - - - - - ATTENDING NOTE AND ATTESTATION: Time: Minutes of unit/floor time I spent rendering this evaluation and management service: 95; of this time, the number of minutes that were spent on counseling and/or coordination of care was: 75; The counseling/coordination of care generally consisted of: reviewing records, speaking with nursing and physician staff and attempting to reach family. - - - - - ATTENDING SIGNATURE: Electronically signed by **NAME[YYY ZZZ], MD at 11:56; **NAME[ZZZ, YYY] ; 2457; **DATE[Nov 5 2009]; 11:56 - - - - - VISIT CODE(S): 99254 Rounding Report: ATTENDING:**NAME[XXX, WWW M] SERVICE:Cardiology ALLERGIES:penicillin, sulfa drugs ROUNDING REPORT TIME:**DATE[Nov 05 2009]
